Description: Typical average power for pulsed laser cleaning of soft metals like Europium to avoid melting (mp 826°C); conservative range due to low thermal conductivity (~14 W/m·K); recommended starting low to test. Source: General manufacturer specs (e.g., Coherent cleaning systems for metals, 10-200 W range); limited specific Europium data, adapted from Al cleaning studies (Opt. Lasers Eng., 2018).
Green wavelength for optimal Europium absorption
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning
Nanosecond pulse width for controlled ablation
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning
Optimal beam overlap for complete coverage
